body:
I tried to reproduce based on your instructions (throw an RpcException from the server-side handler and check that I get StatusCode.InvalidArgument on the client side) and everything worked as expected. 

I'm going to close this issue as "not reproducible". If you can provide more data on how to reproduce, I can reopen.
Can you run with GRPC_VERBBOSITY=debug as described in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/TROUBLESHOOTING.md? Perhaps that will tell us more.

This is the server running as requested

```console
$ GRPC_VERBOSITY=DEBUG dotnet run -p GreeterServer/
D0312 11:38:22.745150 Grpc.Core.Internal.UnmanagedLibrary Attempting to load native library "/home/jose/.nuget/packages/grpc.core/1.17.0/lib/netstandard1.5/../../runtimes/linux/native/libgrpc_csharp_ext.x64.so"

Greeter server listening on port 50051

W0312 11:38:40.454152 Grpc.Core.Server Exception while handling RPC. System.InvalidOperationException: Call error: 10
   at Grpc.Core.Internal.CallErrorExtensions.CheckOk(CallError callError) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\Internal\CallError.cs:line 62
   at Grpc.Core.Internal.CallSafeHandle.StartSendStatusFromServer(ISendStatusFromServerCompletionCallback callback, Status status, MetadataArraySafeHandle metadataArray, Boolean sendEmptyInitialMetadata, Byte[] optionalPayload, WriteFlags writeFlags) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\Internal\CallSafeHandle.cs:line 138
   at Grpc.Core.Internal.AsyncCallServer`2.SendStatusFromServerAsync(Status status, Metadata trailers, Nullable`1 optionalWrite) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\Internal\AsyncCallServer.cs:line 143
   at Grpc.Core.Internal.UnaryServerCallHandler`2.HandleCall(ServerRpcNew newRpc, CompletionQueueSafeHandle cq) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\Internal\ServerCallHandler.cs:line 85
   at Grpc.Core.Server.HandleCallAsync(ServerRpcNew newRpc, CompletionQueueSafeHandle cq, Action continuation) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\Server.cs:line 346
```

An the client:
```console
$ GRPC_VERBOSITY=DEBUG dotnet run -p GreeterClient/
D0312 11:38:40.333613 Grpc.Core.Internal.UnmanagedLibrary Attempting to load native library "/home/jose/.nuget/packages/grpc.core/1.17.0/lib/netstandard1.5/../../runtimes/linux/native/libgrpc_csharp_ext.x64.so"
D0312 11:38:40.366065 Grpc.Core.Internal.NativeExtension gRPC native library loaded successfully.
D0312 11:38:40.366999 140198980872000 /var/local/git/grpc/src/core/lib/iomgr/ev_posix.cc:169: Using polling engine: epollex
D0312 11:38:40.367104 140198980872000 /var/local/git/grpc/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/native/dns_resolver.cc:338: Using native dns resolver
D0312 11:38:40.397160 140198980872000 /var/local/git/grpc/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/native/dns_resolver.cc:279: Start resolving.
I0312 11:38:40.397800 140198980872000 /var/local/git/grpc/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/subchannel.cc:841: New connected subchannel at 0x1bfaf70 for subchannel 0x7f81ec0026c0

Unhandled Exception: Grpc.Core.RpcException: Status(StatusCode=Cancelled, Detail="Cancelled")
   at Grpc.Core.Internal.AsyncCall`2.UnaryCall(TRequest msg) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\Internal\AsyncCall.cs:line 78
   at Grpc.Core.DefaultCallInvoker.BlockingUnaryCall[TRequest,TResponse](Method`2 method, String host, CallOptions options, TRequest request) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\DefaultCallInvoker.cs:line 46
   at Grpc.Core.Interceptors.InterceptingCallInvoker.<BlockingUnaryCall>b__3_0[TRequest,TResponse](TRequest req, ClientInterceptorContext`2 ctx) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\Interceptors\InterceptingCallInvoker.cs:line 51
   at Grpc.Core.ClientBase.ClientBaseConfiguration.ClientBaseConfigurationInterceptor.BlockingUnaryCall[TRequest,TResponse](TRequest request, ClientInterceptorContext`2 context, BlockingUnaryCallContinuation`2 continuation) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\ClientBase.cs:line 174
   at Grpc.Core.Interceptors.InterceptingCallInvoker.BlockingUnaryCall[TRequest,TResponse](Method`2 method, String host, CallOptions options, TRequest request) in T:\src\github\grpc\src\csharp\Grpc.Core\Interceptors\InterceptingCallInvoker.cs:line 48
   at Helloworld.Greeter.GreeterClient.SayHello(HelloRequest request, CallOptions options) in /home/jose/Desktop/grpc/examples/csharp/Helloworld/Greeter/obj/Debug/netstandard1.5/HelloworldGrpc.cs:line 108
   at Helloworld.Greeter.GreeterClient.SayHello(HelloRequest request, Metadata headers, Nullable`1 deadline, CancellationToken cancellationToken) in /home/jose/Desktop/grpc/examples/csharp/Helloworld/Greeter/obj/Debug/netstandard1.5/HelloworldGrpc.cs:line 98
   at GreeterClient.Program.Main(String[] args) in /home/jose/Desktop/grpc/examples/csharp/Helloworld/GreeterClient/Program.cs:line 30

```

The message is pretty clear. You're trying to use illegal characters in the metadata value.
The spec https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/PROTOCOL-HTTP2.md   only allows `ASCII-Value â†’ 1*( %x20-%x7E ) ; space and printable ASCII` (you probably have newline characters in your msg.

To overcome this limitation, you can use binary-valued metadata. 
A common best practice is to send exception details (e.g. stack trace) in form of a protocol buffer message serialized in a binary-valued metadata entry.
Example: 
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/a76465c65cca37dbb85adc7d97c5d4af367bef0f/src/csharp/Grpc.IntegrationTesting/CustomErrorDetailsTest.cs#L119
